item.description:
**TICKETS ARE SOLD OUT FOR THIS PERFORMANCE**
The box office told one of our members that there is a waiting list for Saturday night. The waiting list will begin taking names at 7 PM Saturday. Chances are that there will be some tickets, but no one knows how many.

It's up to you if you want to get there at 7 pm to put your name on the waiting list and see if you get a ticket.

Please update your RSVP accordingly. Thanks!

.............................................

Life is a Cabaret...

Brown University is performing the musical "Cabaret," which is a blast.

Liza Minelli made it famous with the film version, but it's been revamped and is way better onstage. Here is a clip with John Stamos.

If you don't know the story, it takes place in a seedy cabaret in pre-war Berlin. The story revolves around Sally Bowles, a dancer who is kicked out of the club, and falls in love with an American writer. The music has been redone, and it's amazing.

Brown Theatre has general seating, so please buy your ticket ahead of time through the Brown box office. Adult tickets are $17, student tickets are $7.

The show starts at 8 pm on Saturday, Feb. 28. Let's meet in the lobby of Stuart Theatre at 7:15 pm, so we can sit together. Free parking is available on the street and in campus lots on weekends.

After the play, we can go around the corner to Andreas on Thayer for Greek food. They're open until 2 am.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in lobby before show -- look for Meetup sign
item.name: Cabaret -- Brown Theatre
